generalDescription: If you have suggestions on how to improve this website, submit an issue or pull request at https://github.com/fairtracks/fairtracks.net
GitHub repository of the TrackFind web service and API
GiHub repository of FAIRTrack augementation service app
GitHub repository of FAIRTrack genomic tracks JSON Schema validation app
GitHub repository of FAIRtracks JSON-to-GSuite converter
TrackFind API's script hosted at the Genomic Hyperbrowser project GitHub
GitHub repo of Track Hub Registry, with original FAIRtracks branch
GitHub repo of reimplementation of Track Hub Registry (under development)
FAIRTrack web page listing EPICO relevant GitHUB repositories
A web application / RESTful API enabling precision metadata queries across the TrackHub Registry and other portals.
FAIRtracks augmentation is a RESTful API to generate augmented content for minimal FAIRtrack JSON documents automatically.
FAIRtracks validator service is a RESTful API for checking query's consistency against FAIRtrack draft standards.
FAIRtracks JSON-to-GSuite converter is a RESTful API to convert genomic metadata files following FAIRtracks JSON format to tabular GSuite format files.
GSuite Hyperbrowser is a web service based on Galaxy offering multiple relevant tools to handle, process and analyse genomic tracks.
Track Hub Registry is a web search engine (w/ RESTful API) indexing genomic files in track hubs such as UCSC and Ensembl.
BLUEPRINT/EPICO is a web-based tool exploring gene and genomic regions' epigenomic information produced by the BLUEPRINT consortium.
Minimal metadata model enabling exchange across data portals, precision search and analysis.
A tabular file format systematically supporting all types of tracks. GTrack facilitates parsing and manipulation, allows for custom extensions, and provides efficient storage.
Tabular file collecting information on locations of track collections, preprocessing, analysis strategy, and reference genome.

unorderedId: More information is present in the GitHub repository.

generalDescription: BioXSD is a unified data standard for biomolecular sequences, features, alignments, and references to facilitate programmatic data access.
Introduction to genomic tracks for genomic data representation with examples of possible genomic analysis.
Overview of main online tools to display the contents of genomic tracks.
Overview of the mathematical models used for categorization and analysis of different types of tracks.
Presentation of tools and services to find relevant genomic tracks. Description of TrackFind.
Overview of the most common genomic track collections and associated cataloguing services.
Overview of tools for independent and integrative analysis of genomic tracks.
Presentation of the various metadata models currently in use in the community.
Presentation of globally unique identifier solutions to identify track files and register their creation context.
Characterization of ontologies and their roles in identifying biological terms to improve FAIR interoperability.
Overview of FAIR validation tools and services for genomic data and metadata.
Characterization of main file track formats and standards for specific genomic data usage and analysis.
Description of FAIR interoperability role and implementation with FAIRTracks tools and services.
